intro: Chaetogastra connata, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. The species is noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
